# FlipShit
This is probably the stupidest thing I've created. A simple hello world program is 657 characters long. 
There are seven commands in this language. There are no spaces between the commands, and all commands are three letters long.
nul-Adds a single zero to the stack 
prt-Prints the last value of the stack
sif-Shifts the stack one place to the left 
pta-Add to the last value of the stack to the print list to print later as an ASCII character.(This does not print it)
ptc-Clear the print list
pt8-Take the print list, interpret it as binary and turn that binary into an ASCII value to print.
flp-Flip the value last in the stack. (It's one it's now a zero if it's a zero it's now a one)
Example of code:
